title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
I’m starting this blog to share ideas and projects at the crossroads of digital scholarship and ocean heritage.
By day, I work in Digital Scholarship at the University of Southampton helping make library collections more open, accessible, and engaging. I also support ocean advocacy through digital work with the Ocean Decade Heritage Network.
This blog is a place for me to think out loud. Expect posts research communication, digital tools, maybe some code, and probably a few ocean-related tangents too.
All views here are my own.

Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: About me
text:
I’m a Learning Technologist and Digital Scholarship Administrator at the University of Southampton, where I support open, accessible, and innovative ways of engaging with library collections. I’m also Digital Engagement Manager for the Ocean Decade Heritage Network, working at the intersection of heritage, science communication, and ocean advocacy.
This blog brings together my interests in digital scholarship and ocean heritage. I write about open knowledge, digital tools, research communication, and the intersections between culture, science, and the sea.
